info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 14 at 2:04PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Coke, southeastern Nolan, southwestern Taylor and northwestern Runnels Counties through 245 PM CDT... At 204 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Coronados Camp, moving south at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Winters, Hylton, Wingate, Happy Valley, Bradshaw, Fort Chadbourne, Coronados Camp, Lake Abilene, Shep, Wilmeth, Drasco, Pumphrey and Oak Creek Reservoir. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
